content:
I'm happy to help!

Firstly, congratulations on taking a Data Mining course and working on a group project! That's a great way to apply your skills to real-world problems.

Now, regarding your thesis on AI's impact on healthcare outcomes, I've got some excellent resources to share with you. Here are some reliable sources and repositories where you can find datasets related to medical diagnosis:

1. **National Institutes of Health (NIH) datasets**:
	* National Library of Medicine's (NLM) datasets: [https://www.nlm.nih.gov/datasets/index.html](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/datasets/index.html)
	* National Cancer Institute's (NCI) Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) program: [https://seer.cancer.gov/data/](https://seer.cancer.gov/data/)
2. **Healthcare datasets on Kaggle**:
	* Kaggle has an extensive collection of healthcare datasets, including those related to diagnosis, disease prediction, and patient outcomes: [https://www.kaggle.com/datasets?search=healthcare](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets?search=healthcare)
3. **UCI Machine Learning Repository**:
	* This repository has a dedicated section for healthcare datasets, including those related to diagnosis, disease classification, and patient outcomes: [https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets.php?area=health](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets.php?area=health)
4. **MIMIC-III Critical Care Database**:
	* A large, publicly available dataset of de-identified critical care data from patients in intensive care units: [https://mimic.physionet.org/](https://mimic.physionet.org/)
5. **OpenI**:
	* A dataset of radiology images and associated clinical data: [https://openi.nlm.nih.gov/](https://openi.nlm.nih.gov/)
6. **PhysioNet**:
	* A repository of physiological signal processing datasets, including ECG, EEG, and other medical signals: [https://physionet.org/](https://physionet.org/)
7. **Google Dataset Search**:
	* A search engine specifically designed for datasets, which can help you find relevant healthcare datasets: [https://datasetsearch.research.google.com/](https://datasetsearch.research.google.com/)
8. ** figshare**:
	* A platform for sharing and discovering research data, including healthcare datasets: [https://figshare.com/](https://figshare.com/)
9. **Dryad**:
	* A digital repository of datasets associated with published research, including healthcare studies: [https://datadryad.org/](https://datadryad.org/)
10. **Government health datasets**:
	* Many government agencies, such as the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), provide datasets related to healthcare outcomes and diagnosis: [https://www.data.gov/health](https://www.data.gov/health)

Remember to carefully review the terms of use and any applicable licenses for each dataset before using them in your research.

Good luck with your thesis, and I hope these resources help you find the datasets you need!
